timeline.message: Instrument ActionInvocation to get correct timings. Refactor to use latest o11y SDK and API.
First passing test for struts instrumentation.
Manage scope properly in Struts advice. Use existing handlerSpan method to assert struts handler span detection. Make Struts controller behave similarly with other HttpServerTest implementations.
Update server span name when path params are used.
Instrument ActionInvocation to get correct timings. Refactor to use latest o11y SDK and API.
First passing test for struts instrumentation.
Manage scope properly in Struts advice. Use existing handlerSpan method to assert struts handler span detection. Make Struts controller behave similarly with other HttpServerTest implementations.
Update server span name when path params are used.
Account for GStrings in asserted values.
Giving up on getting to work user-friendly assertion messages. Moving controller to a package, as ognl inside struts can't handle classes with no packagaes.

timeline.author: trask

timeline.bodyText: can you submit a PR to opentelemetry-java to add these to SemanticAttributes?
timeline.author: trask

replies.bodyText: Do I understand correctly, that to update SemanticAttributes.java I have to update https://github.com/open-telemetry/opentelemetry-specification/blob/master/semantic_conventions/trace/general.yaml from which SemanticAttributes.java s eventually generated?
replies.author: vovencij

replies.bodyText: oh yes, good find, I believe that's the correct spot
replies.author: trask

replies.bodyText: @trask are you Ok with merging this PR before we have spec updated, right?
replies.author: iNikem

timeline.author: trask

timeline.bodyText:
It looks like struts has the concept of interceptors
https://struts.apache.org/core-developers/interceptors.html
Is it possible to define an interceptor and register it, instead of instrumenting the action invocation directly? While it wouldn't need to be in this PR, it would make it much easier to separate out library, nonagent instrumentation.
timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: Yes, interceptors definitely can be used for a library. Moved current instrumentation to javaagent sub-project to accommodate for the library version. Which I will do as a separate PR.
replies.author: vovencij

timeline.message: Rename struts-2 to struts-2.3. Move autoinstrumentation to javaagent sub-folder to accommodate for library.

timeline.bodyText: We have recently switched to using tracer()
timeline.author: iNikem

timeline.bodyText: You already have this as serverSpan local variable.
timeline.author: iNikem

timeline.message: Use tracer() instead of TRACER and other minor tweaks.
Nicer way for asserting values returned from a method call.
